It would really be as simple as making an URF mode EoN that has an extremely high baseline CD, so that when it is reduced by 80% it ends up being the same as the normal version. We see mode/map specific items in the game already.

Obviously having a 1min CD GA would be highly undesirable, as well as many other passive items. But EoN provides very high damage, decent MR, AND you can have an infinite Spell Shield at the ready.
making special corner cases for things is horrible game design

I agree with the principle but I disagree with the application.

In TT and ARAM there are actually several changed items and cooldowns.

The game design principle for consistency only applies when there is an expectation and an obvious juxtaposition between the two, "Why can't I ult malphite as Cass like everyone else?"

In URF, everything is different, the expectation is that when you compare something from URF to SR, it's going to be different in numbers, and even different in context of usage. In this case I think it's fine.

EoN is an active while banshee's is passive. So EoN isn't getting special treatment compared to other items that's just the game mode. You could argue that passives should get the same reduced cooldowns but then you'd have some real crazy stuff, like GA on a 1 min cooldown, or Trinity force on a .3 second cooldown and trust me, you do not want trinity force on a .3 second cooldown.
Maybe less obvious but Warmogs on a 1.6 second CD. If you stun a guy and walk a way a little the Warmogs would activate and start healing you.
isnt there reduced sustain in URF tho?
Not sure why you got downvoted for literally asking a question and the sustain goes back to normal as the game goes on
